title: Humoral and Cell-Mediated Immune Responses to Vaccinia Virus Immunization

producedBy.name: Humoral and Cell-Mediated Immune Responses to Vaccinia Virus Immunization

values: Received a single dose of Dryvax within the previous 1-48 months
Individuals who volunteer to be in the study
Indivduals who have unique subject identification number
Subjects who have no underlying immunocompromising conditions
Preclude prior immunization/exposure more than 48 months ago
Individuals who received a dose with documented 'no take'
Subjects who have participated in an experimental trial involving an unlicensed smallpox vaccine

creators.name: Population Genetics Analysis Program: Immunity to Vaccines/Infections

values.value: Our broad objective is to examine the role of candidate human immune response gene polymorphisms (and their receptors, expression and function) in inter-individual variability in vaccinia vaccine-induced humoral and cell-mediated immune responses among a cohort of 500 recently vaccinated subjects.  https://www.fbo.gov/index?s=opportunity&mode=form&tab=core&id=4fe38afb31cad52ce3d9ce016a3990bb

dimensions.description: An ELISPOT-based assay of the number of vaccinia-specific IFN-g-producing cells in total PBMC after in vitro restimulation with inactivated vaccinia virus.
An ELISPOT-based assay of the number of vaccinia-specific IFN-g producing CD8+ T cells after in vitro restimulation with inactivated vaccinia virus.
HLA Typing for 8 Loci: HLA-A, B, C, DRB1, DQA1, DQB1, DPA1 and DPB1.

An Illumina-based and/or TaqMan-based assay of single nucleotide polymorphisms associated with known cytokine and cytokine receptor genes.To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

An ELISA-based assay of the ability of serum anti-vaccin ia antibodies to inhibit infection of HeLa cells by recombinant vaccinia virus e xpressing Beta-galactosidase, serum dilution inhibiting 50% of virus activity (ID50 )

PBMC were stimulated in triplicate with either HeLa cell lysate or UV-inactivated vaccinia virus (MOI of 1). Cell culture supernatants were removed after both an early (24-48 hour) and late (3-5 days) time-point and stored at -80 degrees C until the time of assay. Exact time-points were determined after optimization assays. The supernatants were analyzed by ELISA for the quantification of IL-1b, IL-2, IL -4, IL-6, IL-10, IL-12(p35 and p40), IL-18, TNF-a, IFN-a, IFN-b, and IFN-g secretion.
Assessment of the cell-mediated immune response to Vaccinia immunization

An Illumina-based assay of more than 500,000 single nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the entire genome. Measurement Technique: Illumina Infinium BeadChip Assay; 650K for subjects and controls self-reporting as African American; 550K for all others. Total 1000 subjects; 1000 subjects and controls on 550K; Out of 1000 subjects, 300 self-reported African American subjects and controls are also for 650 platform (~86K SNPs).To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

An Illumina-based assay of more than 500,000 single nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the entire genome. Measurement Technique: Illumina Infinium BeadChip Assay; 650K for subjects and controls self-reporting as African American; 550K for all others. Total 1000 subjects; 1000 subjects and controls on 550K; Out of 1000 subjects, 300 self-reported African American subjects and controls are also for 650 platform (~86K SNPs).To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.
A flow cytometry-based assay of HLA class I and class II cell surface expression by CD4+ and CD8+ cells from a mixture of PBMC restimulated in vitro with inactivated vaccinia virus

acknowledges.name: Population Genetics Analysis Program: Immunity to Vaccines/Infections

description: Our broad objective is to examine the role of candidate human immune response gene polymorphisms (and their receptors, expression and function) in inter-individual variability in vaccinia vaccine-induced humoral and cell-mediated immune responses among a cohort of 1,000 vaccinated subjects.
